resources.string: Invalid value! Please set the value from %d to %d.
IDD interval time[sec] (If this is too small, might be raised to +5min by scheduler)
In case of scroll gesture, 0 is for first touch position, 100 for last.
Loops Prompt show count to stop
Show touch area of side bar
Allow user to change the width of side bar
Sidebar start and close animation time
Threshold that can display SS oobe
Slide your finger to return to the previous screen
Here you can fine tune the position, size, and opacity of the bar. You can also move the bar directly by pressing and holding it.

"View menus or functions using the Side sense bar. By default, double-tapping will show the Side sense menu, sliding up will show the Multi-window menu, and sliding down will return you to the previous screen. By touching and holding the bar, then dragging it, you can move it up and down, or anywhere on the screen that you like."

"Easily access useful functions by performing the gestures below on the Side sense bar at the edge of the screen. - Double-tap: Open the Side sense menu - Slide up: Open the Multi-window menu - Slide down: Previous screen (Go back)
The Side sense menu allows you to quickly open apps, as well as display another app in a pop-up window above the main screen. You can split the screen and display two apps at once in just one or two taps from the Multi-window menu."

"The Side sense bar on the side of the screen makes it easy to use your device with one hand. Double-tap to show predicted apps based on your device usage.
Slide your finger on the Side sense bar to return to the previous screen."
Hide the bar and disable Side sense to prevent unexpected operations while interacting with the touchscreen

"[Gestures] You can assign actions to any of the three Side sense gestures (double-tap, slide up, and slide down). To change this, go to the settings screen.
[Multi-window] This new menu allows you to select two apps to display on the split screen. You can assign this feature to a Side sense gesture, or add a shortcut to it on the Home screen."

"[Gestures] You can assign actions to any of the three Side sense gestures (double-tap, slide up, and slide down). To change this, go to the settings screen.
[21:9 Multi-window] This new menu allows you to select two apps to display on the split screen. You can assign this feature to a Side sense gesture, or add a shortcut to it on the Home screen."
You can also adjust the touch position guide by touching and holding it, then dragging it up and down, or moving it anywhere on the screen you like.

"You can display two apps at once by splitting the screen. Select the apps you would like to be displayed in the top and bottom half of the screen. You can open a menu for Multi-window by using the Side sense bar on the side of the screen."

"You can display two apps simultaneously by splitting the screen. Select the apps you would like to be displayed in the top and bottom half of the screen. Slide your finger up the Side sense bar to open the Multi-window menu."

"You can easily access useful functions by double tapping or sliding up/down on the Side sense bar at the edge of the screen.
The Side sense menu which opens when you double tap the bar contains a list of recommended app icons so that you can quickly open apps."

"Double-tap the Side sense bar on the side of the screen to show predicted apps based on your device usage.
Slide your finger on the Side sense bar to return to the previous screen."
Lower part of Multi-window. Now you can select an app to be displayed on the lower part of Multi-window.
Upper part of Multi-window. Now you can select an app to be displayed on the upper part of Multi-window.

"No app/shortcut is assigned to this gesture.
Select an app/shortcut to assign to this gesture in the next screen."
Tap here to make the most out of your Xperia
Slide your finger along the sensor at the side of the screen to return to the previous pane
Side sense automatically detects positions being touched by user
Set a position where Side sense works and how your touch is detected
Dashboard lets you quickly change or check the status of your most used settings.
Flick down on the bar: Go back
Flick up on the bar: Open App launcher menu

"Do you want to turn off Side sense?
You can turn it on again in the settings later."
Side sense has detected repeated double-tapping
When you want to quickly turn the network on or off, you can flick the Side sense bar inward towards the screen to easily display the Dashboard with one hand.
You can change gesture function assignments from the settings.
You can change which actions are assigned to which gestures from the settings.

You can access menus and convenient functions at any time with a single action by performing gestures (Flick inward towards the screen/Flick up/Flick down) on the Side sense bar at the edge of the screen.
"Side sense is currently unavailable. Enable this setting to use Side sense again."
You can now use Side sense
To use this function, enable \"Side sense\" > \"Display over other apps\" on the next screen.
Even when the bar is hidden, you can display the menu from shortcuts such as App launcher on the home screen.
Even when the bar is hidden, you can display the menu from shortcuts such as Window manager on the home screen.
You can choose whether to show or hide the Side sense bar for each app
Select apps that use the Side sense bar
Close the pop-up window and try again
Customize useful functions that can be activated with gestures. For example, you can take screenshots or open apps with a single action.
Easily access useful functions by performing the gestures below on the Side sense bar at the edge of the screen.
- Flick inward towards the screen: Open Dashboard
- Flick up: Open App launcher menu
You can quickly change or check the status of your most used settings from the Dashboard.

The App launcher menu allows you to quickly open apps, as well as display another app in a pop-up window above the main screen. You can open the Multi-window menu that splits the screen and display two apps at once.
Tap here to learn more about Side sense

Sensors at the side of the screen make it easy to use your device with one hand. By default, double-tapping shows predicted apps based on your device usage, sliding up switches to Multi-window mode, and sliding down returns to the previous screen.

"Sensors at the side of the screen make it easy to use your device with one hand. Double-tap to show predicted apps based on your device usage.
Slide your finger up or down to return to previous screen."
You can revisit this guide at any time from Settings > Operation & View > Multitasking usage guides
You can revisit this guide at any time from Settings > Appearance > Multitasking usage guides
See explanations of the split-screen and Side sense functions
See explanations of the split-screen, pop-up window, and Side sense functions
You can control headphone settings directly from the Dashboard
You can control headphone settings directly from the Side sense menu
You can control headphone settings directly from the Side sense menu
Turn on Side sense on the next screen
Add a headphone control panel here?
This enables the operation of Side sense on the screen for situations such as when the edge of the device is covered by a case
Operate on inner edge of screen
Tap here to improve app prediction accuracy
Allow access to location data to improve prediction accuracy of apps shown on the Side sense menu
Enable Side sense on lock screen
Show Side sense menu on lock screen
Select a faster option to reduce the time required to touch and hold before being able to move the bar or floating icon

"Suitable for quick, temporary operations. You can launch a maximized pop-up window from a notification, such as in the case below: 1. While viewing a browser in the main screen, you receive an email notification. 2. You launch the email app in a pop-up window. 3. You read and reply to the email. 4. You close the pop-up window and the main screen is returned to its original state.
*In step 1, if using two apps in split-screen such as video and a browser, the state of those two apps will be preserved when you return to the main screen in step 4."
Side sense menu cannot be used now

"Three pairs of apps will be displayed in the Multi-window menu. You can create these pairs yourself. Out of those three, the pairs you don't create will be recommended by Multi-window based on your app usage."
You can create shortcuts to pairs of apps you frequently use. They will be displayed in the Multi-window menu.
This is a shortcut to the Multi-window menu. As this menu is one of the Side sense functions, Side sense must be enabled in the settings to use it.
You can set two of your favorite apps as a pair so that you can open both of them with a single tap
Cannot use this function while %s is in use
Delete the selected pair(s) from Multi-window menu?
You can display two apps simultaneously by splitting the screen. Select the apps you would like to be displayed in the top and bottom half of the screen.
You can also switch to the Multi-window menu from the App launcher menu.
Select app to be shown in lower window
Select app to be shown in upper window

"You can split the screen to display and control two apps at the same time. For example, you can take advantage of the tall screen by watching a horizontal video in the top part of the screen, while scrolling through a full-sized web page in the bottom part.
*Some apps may not support split-screen"
Take advantage of the tall screen by displaying two apps at the same time

"Recommended apps are shown similarly to the App launcher menu, so that you can quickly launch two apps in split-screen. By tapping on the box next to the menu and then tapping an app icon, you can specify which apps you want to display on the top and bottom."

"Recommended apps are shown similarly to the Side sense menu, so that you can quickly launch two apps in split-screen. By tapping on the box next to the menu and then tapping an app icon, you can specify which apps you want to display on the top and bottom."
More about Side sense and the Multi-window menu

"You can choose whether to hide the Side sense bar in certain apps to make focusing on or navigating that app easier.
To hide Side sense when using an app, turn off that app's switch from the list on the next screen."
You can change these settings at any time from Settings > Display > Side sense > Select apps that use the Side sense bar
To use this function in Landscape mode, first launch it in Portrait mode
Use your device with one hand
One-handed mode can be used by turning it on in Display
Adjust the active area for Side sense
Adjust the length of sliding up/down gesture
Adjust gesture input speed and slide length
The app requires the following permission(s) to perform this action.
To grant permissions, go to App info > Permissions.

"You can display and use another app in a window overlaid on top of the main screen. By combining with split-screen, you can display up to three apps at once. The pop-up window can be launched as either maximized or resizable.
*Pop-up window may be unavailable with some apps *Pop-up window may be unavailable depending on conditions set by the apps on the main screen. *You can only have one pop-up window open at a time. If you open a new pop-up window, the previous one will be closed."
You can display and use another app in a window overlaid on top of the main screen
Delete the selected app(s) from Side sense menu?
Delete the selected widget(s) from %s menu?

"Suitable for simultaneous use of up to three apps at a time. When launching from the Recent apps screen or Side sense menu, the pop-up window will be resizable. For example, you can display a video in a small pop-up window while using a browser on the main screen.
*You can freely change the size and position of resizable pop-up windows. The pop-up window can also be changed into an icon to make it even smaller."

"When the pop-up window has a size-adjustment handle on the top-left corner, you can resize it diagonally towards the top-left. Depending on where the window is located on the screen, the handle may change position automatically.
Additionally, there is a way to adjust the size of the window in any direction without moving it.
For example, if you drag the handle below the window, you can resize it towards the bottom-left. You can use this method to resize the window in any direction."

"The top 8 apps/shortcuts predicted based on your device usage are shown in the App launcher menu (Main and pop-up). If you wish to show your preferred apps/shortcuts, you can manually add them to the list below. The maximum number of items is 12, but more items may be added using the Recommended function."

"The top 8 apps/shortcuts predicted based on your device usage are shown in the Side sense menu. If you wish to show your preferred apps/shortcuts, you can manually add them to the list below. The maximum number of items is 12, but more items may be added using the Recommended function."

Side sense menu automatically displays 8 app predictions based on device usage. You can also select apps of your own choice. If the number of chosen apps is less than 8, Side sense will suggest the rest.
You can add, delete or change the order of all widgets that you want to show on the Side sense menu.
This is a shortcut to dashboard. Shortcut must be enabled in the settings to use it.
Select shortcuts to show in the Side sense menu
This is a shortcut to the Side sense menu. Side sense must be enabled in the settings to use it.
Customize which apps for the main window (fullscreen) are shown
This feature cannot be used now
Tap the box to select an app to launch
Select an app to launch in a pop-up window
Side sense has been turned off
Access menus and functions by flicking inward towards the screen or flicking up or down on the bar on the side of the screen.
Even while using an app, you can quickly and easily perform these gestures with one hand, without needing to return to the Home screen.
You can customize the action assigned to each gesture.
Access menus and functions by flicking inward towards the screen or flicking up or down on the bar on the side of the screen

"Access menus and functions by double-tapping or sliding up or down on the edge of the screen. Even while using an app, you can quickly and easily perform these gestures with one hand, without needing to return to the Home screen.
- Double-tap: Open the Side sense menu - Slide up: Open the Multi-window menu - Slide down: Previous screen (Go back) You can customize the action assigned to each gesture."

"Access menus and functions by double-tapping or sliding up or down on the bar on the side of the screen. Even while using an app, you can quickly and easily perform these gestures with one hand, without needing to return to the Home screen.
- Double-tap: Open the Side sense menu - Slide up: Open the Multi-window menu - Slide down: Previous screen (Go back) You can customize the action assigned to each gesture.
*Change the position of the bar by pressing and holding then moving it. Furthermore, if you move the bar towards the middle of the screen, it will turn into a circle which can be placed wherever you like. You can interact with the circle using the gestures above, which will still have the same actions you have assigned to them."
Access menus and functions by double-tapping or sliding up or down on the edge of the screen
Access menus and functions by double-tapping or sliding up or down on the bar on the side of the screen
Recommended apps are shown based on your usage history so you can quickly launch an app. You can also display notifications and open features such as One-handed mode.

"Recommended apps are shown based on your usage history so you can quickly launch an app. In addition to launching fullscreen apps, you can also launch a separate app in a smaller pop-up window overlaid on top of another app."
You can access menus and convenient functions at any time with a single action
Adjust transparency of a guide that indicates Side sense touch position
Tap on the same place twice

"On the next page you can practice double-tapping. You can open the Side sense menu from any screen by double-tapping the edge of the screen, allowing you to switch apps without returning to Home screen, and more."
You can also change double-tap speed and slide length in the settings.

"You can practice using Side sense by double-tapping or sliding your finger along the left or right edge of the screen. Note: This is a tutorial and the Side sense menu and other features will not activate."
Touch the edge of the screen, not the edge of the device.
Touch a little closer to the edge of the device
To practice again, close then reopen this screen.
"You will see where Side sense has detected your touch. Use the edge of the screen."
Practice sliding down in this lesson
Practice sliding up in this lesson
"Lastly, try sliding down. By doing so, you can easily return to the previous screen using Side sense, even when your finger can't reach the back button."
Slide your finger a little farther
Slide your finger a little slower
"On the next page you can practice sliding up. This function displays the Multi-window menu, which can be opened from any screen using Side sense."
You can launch an app in a resizable pop-up window from the App launcher menu.
Launch from the App launcher menu
You can chat with friends or check social media while in game by launching a pop-up window from the Game enhancer menu. Features unique to Game enhancer will be available.
In the Multi-window menu displayed when you select the tab on the App launcher menu, you can quickly launch two apps in split-screen with just two taps.
In the Multi-window menu displayed when you slide up on the edge of the screen, you can quickly launch two apps in split-screen with just two taps.
In the Multi-window menu displayed when you slide up on the Side sense bar, you can quickly launch two apps in split-screen with just two taps.
Activate split-screen from the Multi-window menu
You can intuitively select apps for the top and bottom windows from the recommended app cards. The apps shown are recommended based on your usage history.
Tap the Multi-window switch icon at the bottom of the Recent apps screen to display Multi-window switch.

"You can intuitively select apps for the top and bottom windows from the recommended app cards. The apps shown are recommended based on your usage history.
Use the following methods to display Multi-window switch: - Tap the Multi-window switch icon at the bottom of the Recent apps screen - Tap on the Multi-window switch icon that appears after you tap on the border between the top and bottom windows in split-screen"
You can specify an app on the Recent apps screen to launch in a resizable pop-up window.
Launch from the Recent apps screen
You can launch an app in a resizable pop-up window from the Side sense menu.
Launch from the Side sense menu
The App launcher menu which opens when you flick up on the Side sense bar at the edge of the screen contains a list of recommended app icons so that you can quickly open apps.
You can also launch apps from here when you want to use them in a pop-up window overlaid on top of the main screen.
Try flicking the bar inward towards the screen
Try double-tapping the sensor at the side of the screen
"You can split the screen to view two apps at once. Select an app to display on the top and bottom. You can also open a menu for Multi-window by using Side sense at the edge of the screen."
"You can split the screen and view two apps at once. Select the apps to be displayed on the top and bottom. Slide your finger up the edge of the screen to open the Multi-window menu."

"Sensors at the side of the screen make it easy to use your device with one hand. This works in many ways, like double-tap to view Side sense menu, slide down to return to previous screen, or slide up to view Multi-window menu."

"Double-tap the sensor at the side of the screen to show predicted apps based on your device usage.
Slide your finger up or down to return to previous screen."
